Uralic languages are clearly distantly related with Eurasian:

Minun nimeni on Adam
my name is Adam

The language family spread together with PIE either via Corded Ware or the Seima Turbino complex (or both):
https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-018-1522-1

Pronouns

Uralic|cognate|english|note
-|-|-|-
minä |mein…|I
sinä |thyn/Dein|you|Turk sen Seine Hoheit
hän |he|he or she |Turk onu on (man)
me |mir|we
te |thee|you
he |'hem|they

Numbers partly ok with leading k⇨c⇨s sound shift

|NR|names|cognates|
|--|-----|--------|
1| ük, ej | ek ein
2|kekta|second
3|kolmi|𓐍𓂸𓏏 Ϣomte (?)
4|nilji| 𓈖 see naalu …
5|witti|⋍phüti 𓂧𓇋𓏏 χiti
6|kotti|⋍secti
7|sejptä|sept:seven
8|kakta|octo/acht:eight
9|oktem'es|8+1
10|das/tiz|diz=10

*source: Vladimir Skalitcka

all but two numbers align nicely with European languages.
'5' is more closely related to Slavic languages where penta is reduced to n-less peta⋍phiti.
Interestingly '4' shows a similar abnormality as Dravidian.

Negation: nem, ei, а, абу, at

vocabulary sample:
because koska because sest c’est because sillä sendäh sentän žentäh žentän si dull: tylppä Tölpel! dumb tompa rotten korhadt: corroded rotten mäda: Madig ^^

Erzya notable for some clean cognates:
𓋴 𓈖 𓃀 𓏜 šumbra шумбра somber sane healthy
